channel.title: Behance Featured Projects
channel.description: The latest projects featured on the Behance

item.title: Information Graphics: Egmont Publishers UK
item.description: A series of infographic posters designed for internal use within Childrens book publishers Egmont UK, as a means of educating staff on the impact of their jobs. Each poster contains statistics, figures and hints to help staff reach their maximum potential. A bold look was established to compliment the subject but still retain a clear professional and corporate feel.
item.content:encoded: A series of infographic posters designed for internal use within Childrens book publishers Egmont UK, as a means of educating staff on the impact of their jobs. Each poster contains statistics, figures and hints to help staff reach their maximum potential. A bold look was established to compliment the subject but still retain a clear professional and corporate feel.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077
item.description: The teaser announces a new video game (developed by Polish video game company CD Projekt RED) based on Cyberpunk 2020 an RPG system created by Mike Pondsmith back in the 90's.
item.content:encoded: The teaser announces a new video game (developed by Polish video game company CD Projekt RED) based on Cyberpunk 2020 an RPG system created by Mike Pondsmith back in the 90's.

item.title: TINE Melkerampa
item.description: The traditional meets the modern in a symbiosis of visual identity and interior design. The central element of the Melkerampa store concept came to be "Hjemme hos TINE, reflecting the experience of coming home to a friend who always has a spare chair at the kitchen table with coffee on the stove. The long table acts as the centerpiece to the store, inviting visitors to take a rest in between shopping. The informative design on the cheese signs on the shelves is reflected in the digital solution and takes on the task of informing about the brand to new generations.
item.content:encoded: The traditional meets the modern in a symbiosis of visual identity and interior design. The central element of the Melkerampa store concept came to be "Hjemme hos TINE, reflecting the experience of coming home to a friend who always has a spare chair at the kitchen table with coffee on the stove. The long table acts as the centerpiece to the store, inviting visitors to take a rest in between shopping. The informative design on the cheese signs on the shelves is reflected in the digital solution and takes on the task of informing about the brand to new generations.

item.title: Squiryl Social Loyalty on your mobile phone
item.description: Squiryl is a social loyalty platform that allows you to earn loyalty points when you shop or dine. You can then use these points to redeem vouchers and freebies or even trade them with your friends! Squiryl offers free tools for businesses to connect to their customers.
item.content:encoded: Squiryl is a social loyalty platform that allows you to earn loyalty points when you shop or dine. You can then use these points to redeem vouchers and freebies or even trade them with your friends! Squiryl offers free tools for businesses to connect to their customers.

item.title: The Weird Travels Pt.2 / DXTR & Friends 2012
item.description: About the joy of traveling and great times with 'The Weird', some of the most creative people and friends I met so far. The following photos show an excerpt of 2012's collaborative murals, selected paintings and exhibitions in Germany, Austria, Netherlands, Luxembourg, Lithuania and Russia together with: Vidam, Look, QBRK, Nerd, Cone, Fr. Isa, Rookie, Nychos, Herr von Bias, Sumo, Oren and Spike.
item.content:encoded: About the joy of traveling and great times with 'The Weird', some of the most creative people and friends I met so far. The following photos show an excerpt of 2012's collaborative murals, selected paintings and exhibitions in Germany, Austria, Netherlands, Luxembourg, Lithuania and Russia together with: Vidam, Look, QBRK, Nerd, Cone, Fr. Isa, Rookie, Nychos, Herr von Bias, Sumo, Oren and Spike.

item.title: Bruce Lee's: Temple Of Kung Fu Series:1
item.description: This recent collaboration with Round5 and the Bruce Lee family was a great honor to be a part of. Not only was I allowed all access to create great Official Bruce Lee items, I was able to design and develop an entire platform from the ground up. The result is a great line of toys showcasing a true Legend.
item.content:encoded: This recent collaboration with Round5 and the Bruce Lee family was a great honor to be a part of. Not only was I allowed all access to create great Official Bruce Lee items, I was able to design and develop an entire platform from the ground up. The result is a great line of toys showcasing a true Legend.

item.title: A new world
item.description: "A new world" 20-13 is an experimental artwork/illustration I did as a personal project. I'm currently working on a limited edition print version and hope I can give you some updates soon. In the meantime enjoy the digital mobile wallpapers. The idea in short is based on this years doomsday. The end of the world we know and a new world, where all the folks alike did seem: There was no Child, there was no Mother, There was no Change, there was no Other.
item.content:encoded: "A new world" 20-13 is an experimental artwork/illustration I did as a personal project. I'm currently working on a limited edition print version and hope I can give you some updates soon. In the meantime enjoy the digital mobile wallpapers. The idea in short is based on this years doomsday. The end of the world we know and a new world, where all the folks alike did seem: There was no Child, there was no Mother, There was no Change, there was no Other.

item.title: CELEBRITIES #2
item.description: A series of images I have made with famous portrait photographer Paul Mobley. I am working with Paul on his "Celebrities" Book project in which he is shooting celebrities backstage before concerts, in their homes and at hotels while they are on the road. Paul and I brainstorm before each session and try to come up with ideas that best portray their personalities and artistic style. Wether it's subtle color and tone corrections or full out CGi and difficult composites, we do whatever it takes to make a captivating image.
item.content:encoded: A series of images I have made with famous portrait photographer Paul Mobley. I am working with Paul on his "Celebrities" Book project in which he is shooting celebrities backstage before concerts, in their homes and at hotels while they are on the road. Paul and I brainstorm before each session and try to come up with ideas that best portray their personalities and artistic style. Wether it's subtle color and tone corrections or full out CGi and difficult composites, we do whatever it takes to make a captivating image.

item.title: Facebook - New Look & Concept
item.description: progress: http://www.facebook.com/nerbyfred A conceptional and systematic design approach encouraging user behaviour and a greater control of data within a responsive grid. The overall concept draws upon a systematic design approach encouraging user behaviour and a greater control of data. Today, Facebook is a natural part of peoples lives and it's well known that a part of the platform's success is caused by targeted and personalised information. This concept draws upon that theory by giving more control back to the user of what they want and don't want to see, creating a greater and more personal environment when interacting with the interface. I approached the platform from a user perspective and focused on targeted & personalised data while maintaining a visually appealing UI. Facebook has done a good job with this for a long time but we're still not seeing the full extent of what's possible within this platform. I believe the future of digital production, design & development in general lies within personalised or targeted information. Every day we're bombarded with advertising and other media who's desperately trying to get our attention with more traditional (narrative) campaign strategies. I believe in focusing on the platform itself and adding value that's personal and actually useful for its end user.
item.content:encoded: progress: http://www.facebook.com/nerbyfred A conceptional and systematic design approach encouraging user behaviour and a greater control of data within a responsive grid. The overall concept draws upon a systematic design approach encouraging user behaviour and a greater control of data. Today, Facebook is a natural part of peoples lives and it's well known that a part of the platform's success is caused by targeted and personalised information. This concept draws upon that theory by giving more control back to the user of what they want and don't want to see, creating a greater and more personal environment when interacting with the interface. I approached the platform from a user perspective and focused on targeted & personalised data while maintaining a visually appealing UI. Facebook has done a good job with this for a long time but we're still not seeing the full extent of what's possible within this platform. I believe the future of digital production, design & development in general lies within personalised or targeted information. Every day we're bombarded with advertising and other media who's desperately trying to get our attention with more traditional (narrative) campaign strategies. I believe in focusing on the platform itself and adding value that's personal and actually useful for its end user.

item.title: Sleipnir
item.description: Typography branding project based on Norse mythology. Sleipnir, the eight-legged horse (Norse). Designed using stylistic elements from an experimental typeface of the same name.
item.content:encoded: Typography branding project based on Norse mythology. Sleipnir, the eight-legged horse (Norse). Designed using stylistic elements from an experimental typeface of the same name.
